channel.title: R visualization on Coronavirus Cabin Fever
channel.description: Recent content in R visualization on Coronavirus Cabin Fever

item.title: Comparing Coronavirus Cases in the World
item.description:
Last modified: 2020-04-14. This is my attempt to visualize some SARS-CoV-2 data with some R code (please pardon the non-optimal layout). German data is obtained from ECDC. Data used from December 31, 2019-April 14, 2020 (not updated every day).
Doubling time for new cases and deaths I chose 10 countries to compare the rates of increase (in terms of doubling time) for the number of cases and the number of deaths, similar to the [NYT case growth rate visualization].

item.title: A Snapshot of the coronavirus outbreak in Germany in April 2020
item.description: Last modified: 2020-04-16. Note: added Saarland data on April 11 as its cases and deaths are rising quite fast while the numbers in many other states are stabilizing. This is my attempt to visualize some SARS-CoV-2 data with some R code (please pardon the non-optimal layout). German data is obtained from the Robert Koch Institute. Data used from March 15-April 7, 2020 (not updated every day). For more extensive information about SARS-CoV-2 in Germany in English, see here.
